#‡§Ø‡•Ç‡§•_‡§´‡•á‡§°‡§∞‡•á‡§∂‡§® #‡§™‡§ø‡§™‡§≤‡•Ä wel done

Another piece of damning evidence published today by @SalmonTroutCons on how the ecological protection of the UK's rivers has collapsed following the progressive de-funding in recent years of the @EnvAgency's inspection and enforcement budgets https://t.co/Dswl3XBr01

Reported hydrogen sulphide on ward 205 at Royal Stoke hospital. Woke me up, which is wonderful when in slow labour üôåüèª   @UHNM_NHS @PHE_uk @PHE_WestMids @Cap_it_off @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL @EnvAgencyMids @EnvAgency
Peace full protest @MrNickKnowles @EnvAgency #StopTheStink @KeepBritainTidy @AirTeamUK close it down enough is enough @ https://t.co/jOAorCHqXl

Is anyone talking about the fact that we‚Äôve not seen any significant rain in most parts of England & Wales for ... six weeks or more?? @FarmersOfTheUK @NFUtweets @FarmersWeekly @NFFNUK @FarmingUK @FarmWildlifeUK @SoilAssociation @EnvAgency @friends_earth @LGSpace @Greenhouse_PR

Today we published ‚ÄúDoing its job?‚Äù, a report on the @EnvAgency and its role protecting English rivers, lakes and streams. The report shows Agency failing to protect rivers, with its hands tied by central Gov. The time to reverse river damage is now https://t.co/y71Uhx7jzp

Our fisheries enforcement officers have been on patrol with @WMPolice following reports of illegal fishing on Sutton Park pools.

Angler booked for out of season fishing on site of special scientific interest (SSSI)

The üêüclose season runs until 15 June - https://t.co/g1jlNXg6wG https://t.co/G3q0LV0uoR

#TeamEA have been on site of a pollution to the River Yarrow in Lancashire. Investigations are currently ongoing into the cause of this incident. Our thanks go to members of the public who reported this to our 24/7 incident hotline - 0800 80 70 60 https://t.co/ge57Ds891o

urls.title: Police team up to target metal and waste crime, protect heritage and the environment - North Yorkshire Police
urls.description: A national clampdown ‚Äì details of which can be revealed today ‚Äì has seen forces across the country focus on metal theft, including the theft of catalytic converters, to prevent an increase in offending as lockdown restrictions ease. The theft of metal is often linked to organised crime, and North Yorkshire‚Äôs isolated, rural areas can [‚Ä¶]

urls.title: ‚ÄòBeaten, chained up and muzzled‚Äô: EA failing to protect rivers, says charity
urls.description: All aspects of the Environment Agency (EA)‚Äôs performance on water pollution have been found wanting in an unflinching new report by fishing and environment charity, Salmon and Trout Conservation.
